alert.note: Alert for East Slopes Sacramento Mountains Below 7500 Feet; Sacramento Mountains Above 7500 Feet (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Wind Advisory issued December 27 at 4:09AM MST until December 27 at 5:00PM MST by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM THIS MORNING TO 5 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON... ...HIGH WIND WATCH IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 5 AM MST TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Southwest winds 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 55 mph through the late afternoon. Winds are expected to increase tonight. Overnight through Tuesday morning winds 30 to 40 mph with gusts up to 60 mph possible. * WHERE...Highest elevations, upper slopes, exposed peaks and ridges, and east slopes of the Sacramento Mountains. * WHEN...The Wind Advisory is valid from 6 AM to 5 PM MST this afternoon, after that the Advisory becomes a High Wind Watch from this afternoon through 5 AM MST Tuesday morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Strong west/southwesterly winds could blow around unsecured objects and holiday decorations. Tree limbs could be blown down. Possible damage to weak structures.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts and warnings for updates on this situation. Fasten loose objects or shelter objects in a safe location prior to the onset of winds. Use extra caution when driving.

area.areaDesc: East Slopes Sacramento Mountains Below 7500 Feet; Sacramento Mountains Above 7500 Feet
